lesson.page: The giant gliding squirrel of Borneo uses a membrane that stretches between its limbs to provide a large surface area and hence high air resistance that will provide lift
It then uses its tail as a rudder to change direction (left to right and up and down)
The tension of the skin membrane allows the animal to increase or decrease its speed of flight
In this game you design a flying squirrel and then fly it from tree to tree
To design it you must choose the size of the body, wingspan and tail
The larger the wingspan the slower the squirrel will fall. Likewise the lighter the body, the slower it will fall
The bigger the tail the easier the squirrel can turn, but also with a bigger tail the squirrel gets heavier
When you have finished setting up the squirrel press "Let's Go" to start the flight
Use the left and right keys to move left and right with your tail. Use the up and down keys to tighten and losen the gliding membrane
